dataIdInfo.idPurp: Following the US Congressional, Florida Senate, and Florida House 2010 Redistricting, the precincts of Hernando County were revised. All Hernando County Precincts fall within US Congress District 11 and Florida Senate District 18. Precincts were realigned to nest within Florida House Districts 34 & 35.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: The GIS.CountyBoundary polygon was split into 39 precincts. Precincts have been drawn to conform to GIS.STREETSCENTERLINE or GIS.V_PARCELS.
dataIdInfo.suppInfo: Effective July 1, 2012, Florida Statutes s. 101.001 requires "Census blocks as based on the most recent US Census will be the default unit for creating or changing precincts."
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Liz Townsend, Hernando County Supervisor of Elections Office.
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: This feature class contains the boundaries for the voter precincts as they were defined and updated in June 2012. These new boundaries were based on the 2010 Census blocks within Hernando County.
descript.purpose: This feature class contains the boundaries for the Hernando County voter precincts.

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the Central GIS would be appreciated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully by the Hernando County Property Appraiser GIS, or by the Central GIS community,no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The Hernando County GIS Department shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
